thread.title: Are these the most UNFORTUNATE names ever?
thread.title_full: Are these the most UNFORTUNATE names ever?

title: Are these the most UNFORTUNATE names ever?
text: 89 shares One of the rudest on the unfortunate list is Mike Litoris. And if that makes you squirm, imagine having to introduce yourself as Mr P. Ennis or Dick Long. Other more innocent unfortunate options include Saad Maan and Chris P. Bacon. Who knew: FEMAIL rounds up some of the most unfortunate names ever Squirmish: One of the rudest on the unfortunate list is Mike Litoris (pictured) Unlucky: Other more innocent unfortunate options include Saad Maan (pictured) Kidding: Some of the names such as Paul Twocock sound like a bad joke (pictured) Incredulous: Others are almost hard to believe (pictured) While some of the names such as Paul Twocock sound like a bad joke, others are more tongue in cheek. One especially funny business card reads Sam Sung, in a nod to the famous electronics company. In one unlucky yearbook, a teacher called Mr Perv is pictured among his class. 'Mr Perv's Fifth Grade,' the accompanying caption reads. Company: In one unlucky yearbook, a teacher called Mr Perv is pictured among his class (pictured) Humorous: One especially funny business card reads Sam Sung, in a nod to the famous electronics company Pity: Spare a thought for these people's names next time you sign your name Whether the parents did it intentionally as a bit of a joke or it was just a pure accident, it's hard not to giggle at the unlikely names. Spare a thought for them next time you sign your name. Do you have a more unfortunate name than these? Email FemailAU@mailonline.com Read more: Share or comment on this article 89
